verbs.description: underreport (third-person singular simple present underreports, present participle underreporting, simple past and past participle underreported)

entries.meaning: To report a number falsely, making it smaller than it ought to be, especially to do so intentionally
examples: The FBI underreported its use of the USA Patriot Act to force businesses to turn over customer information in suspected terrorism cases, according to a Justice Department audit.

entries.meaning: As a group, to report something less frequently than it actually occurs
